conversations.description: Developer asks the genie to review a new Python PR adding a utility function, expecting lint and type‑check feedback.
Team lead triggers a batch review of all open JavaScript PRs and receives a summary of security findings.
A junior engineer requests the genie to suggest a patch for a failing Go test discovered in the diff.
Project manager asks the genie to annotate a large refactor PR with line‑by‑line comments on style violations.
Security analyst invokes the genie to run a static scanner on a Ruby PR that modifies authentication logic.
Developer wants the genie to auto‑apply a suggested import re‑ordering patch to a TypeScript file.
Ops engineer uses the genie to check Dockerfile changes for best‑practice violations and receives recommendations.
The genie is asked to compare the diff of a PR against company coding standards and generate a compliance report.
A reviewer asks the genie to fetch a PR diff, run pylint, and post comments on each pylint warning directly in GitHub.
Product owner requests a quick summary of performance‑related warnings from a C++ PR.
Team initiates a nightly run where the genie automatically reviews all new PRs and posts a checklist status comment.
Developer asks the genie to explain why a particular line in a diff triggers a security alert.
The genie receives a request to generate a one‑sentence summary of a PR’s overall code quality.
A repository maintainer asks the genie to apply a patch that fixes a lint error across multiple files in the PR.
User wants the genie to prioritize findings: show critical security issues first, then style warnings.
QA engineer asks the genie to verify that added unit tests cover new branches using static analysis.
DevOps triggers the genie to ensure all new Terraform files in a PR pass format and security checks.
New contributor asks the genie to rewrite a complex conditional into a more readable form and apply the change.
The genie is used to audit a PR for deprecated API usage and suggest modern equivalents.
Team lead wants a markdown table summarizing all warnings found in a PR for the sprint demo.
Developer asks the genie to fetch a PR diff, run mypy on the Python changes, and post type errors inline.
Security officer triggers the genie to run a secret‑leak scanner on a PR that adds configuration files.
A senior engineer asks the genie to automatically fix all formatting errors using a generated patch.
Product designer wants the genie to comment on accessibility concerns in a new React component PR.
Team uses the genie to batch‑review multiple PRs and receive a consolidated list of high‑severity findings.
Developer requests the genie to generate a code‑snippet example illustrating the proper use of a new API added in the PR.
The genie is asked to verify that all new public functions in a Java library have Javadoc comments.
User wants the genie to suggest a more efficient algorithm for a loop introduced in a Go PR.
Ops team asks the genie to ensure no hard‑coded credentials appear in a new Bash script PR.
Repo owner requests the genie to add a comment explaining a complex regex introduced in a diff.
Developer asks the genie to run ESLint on a TypeScript PR and automatically apply all auto‑fixable rules.
The genie generates a changelog entry summarizing the functional changes in a PR after reviewing the diff.
Team lead wants the genie to flag any use of `console.log` in a production JavaScript PR.
Security auditor asks the genie to run OWASP Dependency‑Check on a PR that updates NPM packages.
Developer asks the genie to rewrite a function with async/await patterns and apply the patch.
The genie is invoked to ensure that new SQL migration files follow naming conventions and include rollback scripts.
Project manager wants the genie to produce a brief risk assessment based on static analysis findings.
A user requests the genie to merge a PR automatically after all comments are resolved and no issues remain.
Team uses the genie to annotate a PR with links to relevant internal style guide sections for each violation.
Developer asks the genie to convert a diff’s `var` declarations to `let`/`const` in a JavaScript PR.
The genie is asked to detect and comment on any cyclomatic complexity spikes introduced in a Python PR.
QA lead requests the genie to verify that new API endpoints have proper input validation checks.
Dev asks the genie to auto‑format all changed files in a PR using Prettier and push a commit.
Security team triggers the genie to flag usage of unsafe functions like `eval` in a newly added script.
Team lead asks the genie to generate a detailed review comment that includes both the issue and a suggested code patch.
Developer wants the genie to summarize the diff in plain English for non‑technical stakeholders.
The genie is used to ensure that added Docker images have a minimal base layer and no root user.
Ops engineer asks the genie to confirm that newly added CI configuration files pass schema validation.
User requests the genie to create a branch from the PR head, apply a patch fixing a bug, and push the new commit.
Team asks the genie to highlight any duplicated code blocks introduced in a large refactor PR.
Developer asks the genie to replace hard‑coded magic numbers with named constants in a C# PR.
The genie is invoked to scan a PR for license header compliance across all added source files.
Product owner wants a concise bullet‑point list of new UI components added in a PR, generated by the genie.
Security auditor asks the genie to ensure all new HTTP calls use HTTPS and flag any insecure URLs.
Team lead requests the genie to auto‑resolve trivial comments (e.g., whitespace) and commit the fixes.
